qas.question: One company that IBM acquired in 2002 is?
In 2003 IBM hosted an online discussion with how many employees?
What technology did IBM use for its 2003 internet-based discussion?
What did IBM use to analyze the results from the online discussion?
How many employees took part in the subsequent online discussion in 2004?
What company did PwC consulting acquire in 2003?
What did employees introduce to change company values?
How many employees worked at PwC consulting in 2002?

plausible_answers.text: ways to implement company values in practice

qas.question: What did employees discuss at the  second Jam event put on by PwC consulting in 2002?
Where did the first discussion take place hosted by PwC consulting in 2002?

context: In 2002, <b5_0>IBM<b5_0/> acquired <a0_0>PwC consulting<a0_0/>. In 2003 it initiated <b6_0>a project<b6_0/> to redefine company values. Using its <a2_0>Jam technology<a2_0/>, it hosted a three-day Internet-based <b9_0>online<b9_0/> discussion of key business issues with <a1_0><b7_0>50,000<b7_0/> employees<a1_0/>. Results were data mined with sophisticated text analysis software (<a3_0>eClassifier<a3_0/>) for common themes. Three emerged, expressed as: "Dedication to every client's success", "Innovation that matters—for our company and for the world", and "Trust and personal responsibility in all relationships". Another three-day Jam took place in 2004, with <a4_0>52,000 employees<a4_0/> discussing <b8_0>ways to implement company values in practice<b8_0/>.
